content.description: Just left of Joy! Joy!, starting at the base of a good sized tree/bush.  Bouldery moves through two pods.  Unfortunately the top only has a single chain anchor making this route slightly dangerous (as of March 2014).  I left a leaver beaner up there just in case anyone else gets a surprise.
content.protection: ~4 bolts to a single chain anchor.  I wouldn't recommend until someone adds a second anchor.

content.description: A short, bouldery route through three bolts to anchors.
Climb small pockets and edges up the red streaked face. Quality stone!
content.location: Right of Blowing Smoke, start left of a bush and belay on top of a rock feature.

content.description: Crux is small holds off the ground. Friction slab climbing with small fingers.
A good deal easier than its neighbor to the left with a nicer finish. Moves between generally good, large pockets with a nice passage near the 2nd bolt.
content.location: Second route from the left on Ren and Stimpy wall.

content.description:
Move up and left into a quasi awkward depression... a few good and sharp holds will appear then a couple of balancy moves will get you onto the jugs out left by a spikey aloe... move right and continue up to the anchors of Blowing Smoke.

This was rated 11a/b in the Limestone Bible... not even close to that hard.
content.location: Starts just left of Blowing Smoke, and joins that route at the third bolt, and shares the same anchor.

content.description: This route takes the sharp and quality rock just right of Burning Love.  A few sharp pulls will get you going and then a small steep section tops you out.
content.location: Last route on the wall at the right side, just right of Burning Love.

content.description: A better and easier route than offerings to the left on this wall.  Nice climbing on good holds.  No mystery, just follow the bolts.  This is rated 5.9+ in the Limestone Bible...no way. Might be the best moderate on the wall.  Probably more like 2.5 stars, but I'll go with 3 compared to other routes on this wall.
content.location: Fourth route from the left... and the first longish looking route on the wall

content.description: Route directly right of Joy!, Joy!.  Bouldery start to a large no-hands rest in a pod, followed by a strange top sequence to the chains.
content.protection: Can't remember exact draw count, but it's maybe 5 bolts max to chains.  Very short.

content.description: Superb pockets for the first three bolts to an easy slab.  Hand eating pockets separated by not-so-great ones...
content.location: The left side of the vertical-to-overhanging part of the Ren & Stimpy Wall, just right of the 5.9+ slab "Burnt Ends".  There is a 2-bolt, 5.11a/b variation that joins "Blowing Smoke" from the left.

climbs.name: Backdraft
climbs.fa: Brian Cabe and Jeff Baldwin 10 April 2010

content.description: A fun, thoughtful (for the grade) route that's a bit more sequential than at first glance.
content.protection: 5 lead bolts to a two bolt anchor with rappel rings.  TR from your own quickdraws, please, to save wear and tear on the anchor.  Thanks!
content.location:
Located on the left side of the Ren and Stimpy Wall.  To the left of "Firestorm" 5.7 (Jeff Baldwin) which is left of "Happy Happy" 5.9+ (Lange Jefferies).

Just to the right of a break in the wall (scratchy gully) which is right of the lower and left most part of the Soul Asylum crag.

content.description: Start at the base of a prickly bush two routes right of Joy!  Joy!.  Good holds and stemming through the first three bolts, to a slab middle section on awesome rock, with a nice overhanging finish on sinker jugs.  Well bolted.
